newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil minister sees Dec trade deficit at $1.2 bln.
newsitem.headline: Brazil minister sees Dec trade deficit at $1.2 bln.

text.p: Brazil is likely to have posted a $1.2-billion December trade deficit, Industry and Commerce Minister Francisco Dornelles was quoted as saying.
The minister told O Globo newspaper that December trade figures will be revealed later this month, but he acknowlegded that Brazil's trade balance may have showed a $5-billion deficit in 1996.
On Tuesday, the ministry announced last month's exports at $3.789 billion. Exports in 1996 amounted to $47.7 billion, a slight 2.67-percent rise over 1995.
